Name: Victoria Memorial
Description: A grand marble museum dedicated to Queen Victoria.
History: Built between 1906–1921 during British rule.
Personal Tips: Visit during sunset for best photos.

Name: Howrah Bridge
Description: Iconic cantilever bridge connecting Kolkata and Howrah.
History: Opened in 1943, one of the busiest bridges in the world.
Personal Tips: Best viewed at dawn or dusk.

Name: Indian Museum
Description: Oldest and largest museum in India.
History: Founded in 1814; holds rare artifacts including Egyptian mummies.
Personal Tips: Allocate 2–3 hours; avoid Mondays (closed).

Name: Park Street
Description: Popular street filled with restaurants, pubs, and shops.
History: Colonial-era street turned modern hub.
Personal Tips: Visit during Christmas for lights.

Name: New Market (Hogg Market)
Description: Historic shopping arcade from the British era.
History: Built in 1874; known for variety of goods.
Personal Tips: Great for souvenirs; bargain prices.

Name: Birla Mandir
Description: Modern white marble temple built by Birla family.
History: Completed in 1996, dedicated to Lord Krishna & Rama.
Personal Tips: Dress modestly and visit during evening aarti.

Name: Science City
Description: India’s largest science centre.
History: Opened in 1997 to promote interactive science learning.
Personal Tips: Best for kids and families; weekdays less crowded.

Name: Maidan
Description: Kolkata’s largest open park known as city lungs.
History: Laid out during British era, used for sports and parades.
Personal Tips: Early morning walk recommended.

Name: Prinsep Ghat
Description: Colonial ghat by the Hooghly river.
History: Built in 1841 to honor James Prinsep.
Personal Tips: Best at sunset; take a boat ride.

Name: Dakshineswar Kali Temple
Description: Famous temple dedicated to Goddess Kali.
History: Built in 1855 by Rani Rashmoni; associated with Ramakrishna.
Personal Tips: Avoid Sundays due to heavy crowd.

Name: Belur Math
Description: Headquarters of Ramakrishna Mission across river.
History: Established by Swami Vivekananda in 1897.
Personal Tips: Go before sunset for calm atmosphere.

Name: Eden Gardens
Description: Historic cricket stadium.
History: Established in 1864; hosted major international matches.
Personal Tips: Check match schedules; guided tours available.

Name: South Park Street Cemetery
Description: 18th-century colonial cemetery.
History: Opened in 1767, contains British tombs.
Personal Tips: Calm and eerie place; photography allowed.

Name: Kalighat Temple
Description: One of 51 Shakti Peeths.
History: Believed to be over 200 years old; major pilgrimage site.
Personal Tips: Avoid weekends; keep belongings safe.

Name: St. Paul’s Cathedral
Description: Anglican cathedral with Gothic architecture.
History: Completed in 1847; designed by Major Forbes.
Personal Tips: Visit during Christmas carols.

Name: Eco Park
Description: Largest urban park in India with theme areas and lake.
History: Opened in 2013 in New Town.
Personal Tips: Try boating and cycling; rent e-vehicles.

Name: College Street (Boi Para)
Description: Asia’s largest second-hand book market.
History: Developed around 19th century educational institutions.
Personal Tips: Carry cash; bargain politely.

Name: Rabindra Sarobar
Description: Manmade lake and urban park in South Kolkata.
History: Built in 1920s as Dhakuria Lake.
Personal Tips: Morning jog recommended; photography spots around bridge.

Name: Nandan
Description: Cultural complex promoting Bengali films.
History: Inaugurated in 1985 by Satyajit Ray.
Nearby Recommendations: Academy of Fine Arts, Coffee House
Personal Tips: Best during film festivals.

Name: Nicco Park
Description: Popular amusement park with rides and water park.
History: Opened in 1991; known as the Disneyland of Bengal.
Personal Tips: Carry sunscreen; weekdays are less crowded.
